div1.p: In the District Court of the Untied States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Antonio Bisegna, alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2679. Motion for Discharge
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled Court:
Comes now the said petitioner and moves that he be discharged forthwith upon the following grounds and for the following reasons, to-wit:
I. That the return of the Immigration Commissioner shows said petitioner is detained and restrained of his liberty for unlawful reasons and contrary to the constitution and laws of the Untied States.
II. That the said examining inspector and the said Scretary of Labor exceeded their authority and their jurisdiction, and their alleged proceedings and decision are null and void.

III. That the alleged reasons for detaining said petitioner are insufficient in that the causes upon which the same are based did not exist prior to the landing of this petitioner, and are not supported by any evidence whatsoever.

IV. That said order of deportation is illegal and insufficient in that it provided for the return of the petitioner to Italy instead of the country whence he came as provided by the laws of the United States.
In the District Court of the Untied States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Antonio Bisegna,k alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington Northern Division FEB 21 1914 Frank L Crosby By EML Deputy
Service of papers in this case may be made upon Alred H. Lundin and Louis E. Shela, Attorneys for Petitioner, at No. Street Room 811 Lowman Building, Block Seattle, Washington.
Lowman & Heaford Co., Seattle, Wash. - Form No. 198.
